display.label: GitHub
display.description: Manage users, repositories, licenses, and more on GitHub

inputs.comments: Authorization URL
inputs.label: Authorize URL

inputs.comments: Token URL
inputs.label: Token URL

inputs.comments: Space-delimited scopes; refer to [GitHub's documentation for details](https://docs.github.com/en/developers/apps/building-oauth-apps/scopes-for-oauth-apps)
inputs.label: Scopes

inputs.comments: Client identifier
inputs.label: Client ID

inputs.comments: Client secret
inputs.label: Client Secret

documentation.description:
To connect to GitHub you will need to [create a new OAuth 2.0 application](https://github.com/settings/applications/new).
Fill in the required fields and supply Prismatic's callback URL as the **Authorization callback URL**: https<!---->://oauth2.prismatic.io/callback

Next click "Generate a new client secret" and copy the values of both the **Client ID** and **Client Secret**.

You are now ready to create the OAuth 2.0 connection to GitHub within Prismatic:

-   Enter the **Client ID** and **Client Secret** values into the same named fields.
-   Determine [what scopes your use case requires](https://docs.github.com/en/developers/apps/building-oauth-apps/scopes-for-oauth-apps) and add those to **Scopes** separating each with a space.

Save your integration and you should now be able to connect and authenticate to GitHub.

display.label: Raw Request
display.description: Send a raw HTTP request to Github API

inputs.comments: Input the path only (/octocat), The base URL is already included (https://api.github.com). For example, to connect to https://api.github.com/octocat, only /octocat is entered in this field.
inputs.label: URL

inputs.comments: The HTTP method to use.
inputs.label: Method

inputs.comments: The HTTP body payload to send to the URL.
inputs.label: Data

inputs.comments: The Form Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: Form Data

inputs.comments: File Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: File Data

inputs.comments: A list of query parameters to send with the request. This is the portion at the end of the URL similar to ?key1=value1&key2=value2.
inputs.label: Query Parameter

inputs.comments: A list of headers to send with the request.
inputs.label: Header

inputs.comments: The type of data you expect in the response. You can request json, text, or binary data.
inputs.label: Response Type

inputs.comments: The maximum time that a client will await a response to its request
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: Enabling this flag will log out the current request.
inputs.label: Debug Request

inputs.comments: The delay in milliseconds between retries.
inputs.label: Retry Delay (ms)

inputs.comments: If true, retries on all erroneous responses regardless of type.
inputs.label: Retry On All Errors

inputs.comments: The maximum number of retries to attempt.
inputs.label: Max Retry Count

inputs.comments: Specifies whether to use a pre-defined exponential backoff strategy for retries.
inputs.label: Use Exponential Backoff

display.label: List Repos

documentation.description: [GitHub](https://github.com) is one of the largest and most advanced development platform in the world providing code repository hosting and more.
documentation.dev:
The [GitHub REST API](https://docs.github.com/en/rest) is extensive, with almost a thousand unique endpoints.
This component has actions that wrap some of those endpoints that are commonly used in integrations.
Please [contact us](https://prismatic.io/contact/) if there are other GitHub endpoints that you would find helpful wrapped in an action.
Alternatively, you can reach for the [Raw Request](#raw-request) action to interact with any GitHub endpoint.
